channel.title: Hi I want to change my ip how?
channel.description:
Hi moparscape,
i recently got ip banned because my account got hacked and was spamming thats what the owner said, and i tryed to login with my other account and it said " unable to connect to server" or someshit like that...
so i was wondering how i can change my ip for free thanks!

item.title: Hi I want to change my ip how?
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

open cmd prompt
ipconfig/release
Ipconfig/renew
restart unplug modem and restart computer, ta mother fucken da.

Read full topic
item.source: Hi I want to change my ip how?

item.title: Hi I want to change my ip how?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:11, topic:413004”][quote author=xryz link=topic=514478.msg3734965#msg3734965 date=1314889575]
its truly isnt that hard to change. do a quick google. a couple keywords would be release and renew.
[/quote]

Yes… Releasing and renewing your router… Doing that on your PC will just give you another local address. Also doing this on your router is still not a very effective way to change your IP as you will have to keep it released for awhile.[/quote]
doing that worked well for me. it shouldnt work though if your isp assigns you a static address though, correct?

Read full topic
item.source: Hi I want to change my ip how?

item.title: Hi I want to change my ip how?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

xryz:

its truly isnt that hard to change. do a quick google. a couple keywords would be release and renew.

Yes… Releasing and renewing your router… Doing that on your PC will just give you another local address. Also doing this on your router is still not a very effective way to change your IP as you will have to keep it released for awhile.

Read full topic

item.source: Hi I want to change my ip how?

item.title: Hi I want to change my ip how?
item.dc:creator: @we_rushed_god we rushed god
item.description:
@we_rushed_god wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:6, topic:413004”][quote author=ExtremeX-Scape™ link=topic=514478.msg3734843#msg3734843 date=1314875923]

You’ll have to wait until your dynamic IP renews (which can take a very long time, mine hasn’t renewed in several months). Or just use a proxy to connect.

Mine hasn’t renewed in 6 years. I still have the same IP.
[/quote]

Call up your ISP and give them a valid reason to change it.[/quote]

Like, “Hey my dog knows my ip and he keeps DDoSing me, and sending me trojans and shit, can u change my ip? XD”

Read full topic
item.source: Hi I want to change my ip how?
